title: A Century of Animated Shorts
description:
Click the link above... Those are the best animated shorts from the last 100 years covering the period from 1906 to 2006... The most recent short in this collection is from 2004... and the oldest is from 1906.

Quote:
As the first century of animation draws to a close, we asked 30 specialists from all over the world to give us a list of their 100 favourite animated shorts since the invention of ÃƒÆ’?ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¯Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¿Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â½mile Cohl. In collaboration with Studio and Variety, the Annecy Festival is pleased to present you this final selection.



However, since those were not all available, the original releaser posted replacement for them. I am not mentionning the reference of the original release and the name of the releaser/ripper per his request.

This collection is monumental and will allow you to discover a plethora of great classic animations, including for my greater pleasure a large amount of QuÃƒÆ’?ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÆ’?Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â©bec National Film Board shorts. The subtitles are not necessary in most cases, I didn\\\&#039;t watch all yet, but it seem that, for most animations, words are not used.
